definition: to sweep the floor/to reach rock bottom/to be at an all-time low
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to lose every scrap of reputation
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)

sentences.english: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻使这所学校名誉扫地。

sentences.english: He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies.
sentences.chinese: 他说他的责难者试图使政府的对外援助政策名声扫地。

sentences.english: Fengjiao swept the floor this morning.
He suffered a loss of prestige when the scandal was publicized .
sentences.chinese: 这件丑事公开后他便威信扫地。

sentences.english: The pants were long enough to cover the heel and swept the floor while walking.
sentences.chinese: 裤长一般盖住鞋跟，走起路来，兼有扫地的功能。

sentences.english: I helped my mother did some housework( mopped the floor, washed clothes) after I have finished my homework.
sentences.chinese: 做完作业后帮妈妈做家务，扫地，洗衣服等。

sentences.english: Americans face a bit sweeping, the Japanese are triumphant.
sentences.chinese: 美国人有点颜面扫地，日本人正得意洋洋。

sentences.english: Three of us sweep and mop the floor and the remainder clean the window.
sentences.chinese: 我们之中三人扫地拖地板，其余的人擦玻璃。

sentences.english: A successful author is equally in danger of the diminution of his fame. (No. 21)
sentences.chinese: 成功的作者同样面临自己名声扫地的危险。

sentences.english: The floor is not swept in case good fortune is swept out the door too.
sentences.chinese: 过年期间也不扫地，以免把福气扫出了门。

sentences.english: The politician became bankrupt in reputation.
I looked out the window. Mable was swishing her broom down the street.
sentences.chinese: 我向窗外望去，只见梅布尔正挥动扫帚沿街扫地。

sentences.english: The reputation and future of a 19-year-old girl is on tenterhooks.
sentences.chinese: 一个只有19岁的女孩似乎就此名誉扫地。

sentences.english: It stands humbled by its foreign-policy blunders and a massive financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 因错误的对外政策和严重的金融危机，使它威风扫地。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a sweeper.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型涉及扫地车。

sentences.english: Li Yong sweep the floor this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上有人看见李勇扫地板。

definition: to mop the floor/(of a gown etc) to trail on the ground/full-length
to get food at a canteen
to pick the edible part of vegetables
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
